Name: Bobby Burns (Craddock's recipe)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist expressed and discarded. Adorn with skewered Luxardo Maraschino Cherry ..
Review: Rich and slightly sweet, laced with spice liqueur - an excellent dram to enjoy alongside the ritualistic serving of haggis.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Harry Craddock 's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book which calls for equal parts rosso vermouth and scotch whisky with three dashes of Bénédictine. Craddock adds that this is " One of the very best Whisky Cocktails and " A very fast mover on Saint Andrew's Day. "
Nutrition: One serving of Bobby Burns (Craddock's recipe) contains 194 calories
